chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
n: nat
S: naryRel n
R: naryRel n

Goal:
naryRel n

Premises:
naryRel = fix naryRel (n : nat) : Set := match n with | 0 => bool | S n0 => nat -> naryRel n0 end : nat -> Set Arguments naryRel _%nat_scope

VectorDef.caseS' : forall (v : VectorDef.t ?A (Datatypes.S ?n)) (P : VectorDef.t ?A (Datatypes.S ?n) -> Type), (forall (h : ?A) (t : VectorDef.t ?A ?n), P (VectorDef.cons ?A h ?n t)) -> P v where ?A : [n : nat R : naryRel n S : naryRel n |- Type] ?n : [n : nat R : naryRel n S : naryRel n |- nat]
VectorDef.case0 : forall P : VectorDef.t ?A 0 -> Type, P (VectorDef.nil ?A) -> forall v : VectorDef.t ?A 0, P v where ?A : [n : nat R : naryRel n S : naryRel n |- Type]
VectorDef.Forall_cons : forall (P : ?A -> Prop) (n0 : nat) (x : ?A) (v : VectorDef.t ?A n0), P x -> VectorDef.Forall P v -> VectorDef.Forall P (VectorDef.cons ?A x n0 v) where ?A : [n : nat R : naryRel n S : naryRel n |- Type]
isPRrel : forall n : nat, naryRel n -> Set
VectorDef.caseS : forall P : forall n0 : nat, VectorDef.t ?A (Datatypes.S n0) -> Type, (forall (h : ?A) (n0 : nat) (t : VectorDef.t ?A n0), P n0 (VectorDef.cons ?A h n0 t)) -> forall (n0 : nat) (v : VectorDef.t ?A (Datatypes.S n0)), P n0 v where ?A : [n : nat R : naryRel n S : naryRel n |- Type]
charFunction : forall n : nat, naryRel n -> naryFunc n
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
Nat.lnot = fun a n : nat => Nat.lxor a (Nat.ones n) : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Nat.lnot (_ _)%nat_scope
Init.Nat.land = fun a b : nat => Init.Nat.bitwise andb a a b : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.land (_ _)%nat_scope
Init.Nat.lor = fun a b : nat => Init.Nat.bitwise orb (Init.Nat.max a b) a b : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.lor (_ _)%nat_scope
Init.Nat.lxor = fun a b : nat => Init.Nat.bitwise xorb (Init.Nat.max a b) a b : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.lxor (_ _)%nat_scope
Nat.ones = fun n : nat => Nat.pred (Nat.shiftl 1 n) : nat -> nat Arguments Nat.ones _%nat_scope
Init.Nat.sqrt = fun n : nat => Init.Nat.sqrt_iter n 0 0 0 : nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.sqrt _%nat_scope
Init.Nat.ldiff = fun a b : nat => Init.Nat.bitwise (fun b0 b' : bool => b0 && negb b') a a b : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.ldiff (_ _)%nat_scope
Init.Nat.log2 = fun n : nat => Init.Nat.log2_iter (Init.Nat.pred n) 0 1 0 : nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.log2 _%nat_scope
gt = fun n m : nat => m < n : nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments gt (_ _)%nat_scope
lt = fun n m : nat => S n <= m : nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments lt (_ _)%nat_scope
Init.Nat.ltb = fun n m : nat => S n <=? m : nat -> nat -> bool Arguments Init.Nat.ltb (_ _)%nat_scope
Init.Nat.div = fun x y : nat => match y with | 0 => y | S y' => fst (Init.Nat.divmod x y' 0 y') end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.div (_ _)%nat_scope
Init.Nat.shiftr = fun a : (fun _ : nat => nat) 0 => nat_rect (fun _ : nat => nat) a (fun _ : nat => Init.Nat.div2) : (fun _ : nat => nat) 0 -> forall n : nat, (fun _ : nat => nat) n Arguments Init.Nat.shiftr (_ _)%nat_scope
Init.Nat.modulo = fun x y : nat => match y with | 0 => y | S y' => y' - snd (Init.Nat.divmod x y' 0 y') end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.modulo (_ _)%nat_scope
Init.Nat.add = fix add (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => m | S p => S (add p m) end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.add (_ _)%nat_scope
Init.Nat.log2_iter = fix log2_iter (k p q r : nat) {struct k} : nat := match k with | 0 => p | S k' => match r with | 0 => log2_iter k' (S p) (S q) q | S r' => log2_iter k' p (S q) r' end end : nat -> nat -> nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.log2_iter (_ _ _ _)%nat_scope
Init.Nat.mul = fix mul (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => 0 | S p => m + mul p m end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.mul (_ _)%nat_scope
Init.Nat.pow = fix pow (n m : nat) {struct m} : nat := match m with | 0 => 1 | S m0 => n * pow n m0 end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.pow (_ _)%nat_scope
Init.Nat.pred = fun n : nat => match n with | 0 => n | S u => u end : nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.pred _%nat_scope
Nat.divide = fun x y : nat => exists z : nat, y = z * x : nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments Nat.divide (_ _)%nat_scope
Init.Nat.gcd = fix gcd (a b : nat) {struct a} : nat := match a with | 0 => b | S a' => gcd (b mod S a') (S a') end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.gcd (_ _)%nat_scope
Nat.sqrt_up = fun a : nat => match 0 ?= a with | Lt => S (Nat.sqrt (Nat.pred a)) | _ => 0 end : nat -> nat Arguments Nat.sqrt_up _%nat_scope
naryFunc = fix naryFunc (n : nat) : Set := match n with | 0 => nat | S n0 => nat -> naryFunc n0 end : nat -> Set Arguments naryFunc _%nat_scope
Init.Nat.sub = fix sub (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => n | S k => match m with | 0 => n | S l => sub k l end end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.sub (_ _)%nat_scope
Init.Nat.odd = fun n : nat => negb (Init.Nat.even n) : nat -> bool Arguments Init.Nat.odd _%nat_scope
Init.Nat.max = fix max (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => m | S n' => match m with | 0 => n | S m' => S (max n' m') end end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.max (_ _)%nat_scope
Init.Nat.min = fix min (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => 0 | S n' => match m with | 0 => 0 | S m' => S (min n' m') end end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.min (_ _)%nat_scope
Nat.Even = fun n : nat => exists m : nat, n = 2 * m : nat -> Prop Arguments Nat.Even _%nat_scope
Nat.Odd = fun n : nat => exists m : nat, n = 2 * m + 1 : nat -> Prop Arguments Nat.Odd _%nat_scope
BinPosDef.Pos.testbit_nat = fix testbit_nat (p : BinNums.positive) : nat -> bool := match p with | BinNums.xI p0 => fun n : nat => match n with | 0 => true | S n' => testbit_nat p0 n' end | BinNums.xO p0 => fun n : nat => match n with | 0 => false | S n' => testbit_nat p0 n' end | BinNums.xH => fun n : nat => match n with | 0 => true | S _ => false end end : BinNums.positive -> nat -> bool Arguments BinPosDef.Pos.testbit_nat _%positive_scope _%nat_scope
BinIntDef.Z.of_nat = fun n : nat => match n with | 0 => BinNums.Z0 | S n0 => BinNums.Zpos (BinPos.Pos.of_succ_nat n0) end : nat -> BinNums.Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.of_nat _%nat_scope
BinNatDef.N.of_nat = fun n : nat => match n with | 0 => BinNums.N0 | S n' => BinNums.Npos (BinPos.Pos.of_succ_nat n') end : nat -> BinNums.N Arguments BinNatDef.N.of_nat _%nat_scope

```coq
unfold naryRel. intros n0. induction n0.
- apply bool.
- intros. apply S. apply IHn0.
Qed.```
